bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Memorandum from H.J. Harwick to Philip Showalter Hench, February 19, 1941

div1.p: Harwick comments on Hench's annual report. Hench will continue working on experimental jaundice and researching the history of yellow fever.

div1.head: Memorandum from H.J. Harwick to Philip Showalter Hench, February 19, 1941
div1.p:
I have read your annual report with
much interest. I think it is not necessary
to submit your recommendations to the
Board inasmuch as I am sure they are will-
ing to have you continue your work on
experimental jaundice and the collection
of data on the conquest of yellow fever.

I am sure Mr. Johnson will be glad
to grant you permission to have photo-
static copies of the material which you
have to return within a short period.

Doctor Rosenberg's appointment has
been extended for another year.
